member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFontModel
member.summary: Provides access to the properties of an optical character font model. This can be a normal font model which is used to inspect for the presence of a character or a blank font model which is used to inspect for the absence of any character.

remarks.PARA: Interface which provide access to the properties of an optical character font model. This can be a normal font model which is used to inspect for the presence of a character or a blank font model which is used to inspect for the absence of any character.

member.summary: Indicates whether this is a normal or blank model. A normal model is used to inspect for the presence of a character and is defined by an image of the character. A blank is used to inspect for the absence of a character defined by a width and height.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFont

remarks.PARA: Interface for an optical character font. This interface includes properties and methods that let you specify the font's confusion threshold, determine how confusable font model pairs are, and the font. It also contains the collection of models that make up the font.

member.summary: Default interface of this class provides access to an optical character font's properties, Compile method, Uncompile method, and the results of compiling the font.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFont.ConfusionThreshold
member.summary: Threshold at which two models are considered Confusable. A compiled font contains Confusion scores for all model pairs in the font. A score greater than this threshold indicates that a model pair should be considered confusing.

remarks.PARA: You specify the (in the range 0.0 through 1.0) to tell the tool the confusion score above which two characters are to be treated as potentially confusing.
As you decrease the confusion threshold, the OCV tool compares more characters with the expected character. As you increase the confusion threshold, the tool compares fewer characters.

event.para: Fires when the confusion threshold changes.
The following state flag may be affected:
Fires when the confusion threshold changes and one or more values also changed.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.summary: The maximum time (msec) allowed to compile the font. If compilation has not finished by the end of the timeout period, it will stop soon thereafter and return E_Cog_TimeoutExpired. This value only applies if TimeoutEnabled is true.

remarks.PARA: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, allowed to compile the font. If the compilation is not finished within the timeout period, it will stop soon thereafter and returns E_Cog_TimeoutExpired.
remarks.NOTE: The actual timeout period can exceed the requested maximum by up to 0.02 seconds on a 200 MHz Pentium I processor. Typical latencies are much lower with faster CPUs.
remarks.PARA: This value applies only when is True.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFont.Confusion(Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFontModel,Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCFontModel)

param.name: model1
param.PARA: The first model.

param.name: model2
param.PARA: The second model.

member.summary: Get the Confusion score for the specified model pair. The Confusion score for a pair of models is the probability, on a scale of 0 to 1, that the two models will be confused with each other during verification.

remarks.PARA: Returns the confusion score for the two supplied models.

The confusion score for two models may not be symmetric. That is, the confusion score calculated for A compared with B may be different than the confusion score obtained for B compared with A. You should supply the model being verified as and the model being evaluated for confusion as .

exception.para: or is not a member of the collection.

returns.PARA: The confusion score, in the range 0.0 through 1.0.

remarks.PARA: Returns true if the specified pair of font models are confusable. Two models are confusable if their confusion score is greater than the defined for this font.

The score for two models may not be symmetric. That is, the confusion score calculated for A compared with B may be different than the confusion score obtained for B compared with A. You should supply the model being verified as and the model being evaluated for confusion as .

returns.PARA: True if the confusion score of and exceeds the of this font, false otherwise.

exception.para: or is not a member of the collection.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified model pair are confusable. Two models are confusable if their Confusion score is greater than the ConfusionThreshold specified by the user.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Scaling uncertainty specifies the expected +/- range of the of the image-to-image variation of a character's scaling factor. This is an unsigned value.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.RotationUncertainty
member.summary: Rotation uncertainty specifies the expected +/- range, in radians, of the image-to-image variation of a character's rotation. This is an unsigned value.

remarks.PARA: The expected range, in radians, of the image-to-image variation of a character's rotation. This is an unsigned value; specify 0.1 to specify a range of -0.1 through +0.1 radians.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.TranslationUncertainty

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: Translation uncertainty specifies the expected +/- range of the image-to-image variation of a character's x,y position. This is an unsigned value.

remarks.PARA: The expected range of image-to-image variation in a character's translation, expressed in the units of the pattern space (the implicit space defined by the origins of the individual character positions). This is an unsigned value; supply a value of 5 to indicate an expected translation from -5 through +5.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.Scaling

remarks.PARA: The expected scaling factor of this character position. The scale is expressed as a factor (1.1 for 10% larger, 0.9 for 10% smaller).
The scale of the expected character position expresses the scale component of the transformation of the font model origin from the pattern origin.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.summary: The expected scaling factor of this character position. The character position is the position of a font model's origin with respect to the expected position of the pattern which the user supplies at run-time.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.Rotation
member.summary: The expected rotation, in radians, of this character position. The character position is the position of a font model's origin with respect to the expected position of the pattern which the user supplies at run-time.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

remarks.PARA: The expected rotation, in radians, of this character position. The rotation is measured from the expected pattern position () to the font model origin.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.TranslationY
member.summary: The expected Y coordinate of this character position. This is the position of a font model's origin with respect to the expected position of the pattern which the user supplies at run-time.

remarks.PARA: The expected y-coordinate of this character position. This is the position of the font model's origin with respect to the expected pattern position ().

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.TranslationX

event.para: Fires when this property changes.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPosition.FontModelCount
member.summary: Number of model candidates for this position. OCV verifies the highest scoring candidate. Models are specified using FontModelName & FontModelInstance. Increasing count adds models with an empty name and instance of zero. Decreasing removes candidates.

remarks.PARA: Number of model candidates for this position. The OCV tool attempts to verify the highest scoring model candidate. If you increase the value of this property, models with an empty name and an instance of 0 are added to the end of the collection. If you decrease the value of this property, models are removed from the end of the collection.

event.para: Fires when this property changes.
The following state flags may be affected:

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterPositions

remarks.PARA: Collection of character positions to be verified by OCV. All of the character positions with non-blank character models are verified in the order in which they are listed in the collection. Positions with blank character models are verified separately after the non-blank positions are verified.

member.summary: Collection of character positions to be verified by OCV. Character positions are verified in the order in which they are listed in the collection. An exception is blank models, which are verified only after all non-blank models have been verified.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVPatternPosition

remarks.PARA: Interface that lets you specify the expected run-time position of the overall pattern. The pattern position is the pose of the pattern origin in the specified space of the input image, where the pattern origin is implicitly defined by the translation, rotation, and scale of the individual s in the pattern.

member.summary: Default interface provides access to the properties for setting the run-time expected position of a pattern and the uncertainty of the expected position. Character positions in a pattern are specified with respect to the expected position of the pattern.

member.summary: Runs the tool using the current parameter settings.

remarks.PARA: Verifies that the is located in the at the . Results are placed in .
remarks.NOTE: This method does not actually raise the exceptions listed below. Use the property to obtain a reference. Then use its property to see if the Run method raised any exceptions.

of the character.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterStatusConstants.Verified
member.summary: The character position passed verification. The verified font model has a matching score greater than or equal to the accept threshold and a confidence score greater than or equal to the confidence threshold.

remarks.PARA: The character position passed verification. The verified font model has a matching score greater than or equal to the accept threshold and a confidence score greater than or equal to the confidence threshold.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterStatusConstants.Confused

remarks.PARA:
The character position failed verification due to confusion.
The found font model has a matching score greater than or equal to the accept threshold, but the confidence score is less than the confidence threshold.

member.summary: The character position failed verification due to confusion. The found font model has a matching score greater than or equal to the accept threshold. However, the confidence score is less then confidence threshold.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCVCharacterStatusConstants.Failed

remarks.PARA: The character position failed verification. No model found that scored above the accept threshold.

member.summary: The character position failed verification. No model found that scored above the accept threshold.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerCharacterStatusConstants
member.summary: Specifies how an individual character's position in the returned arrangement was computed.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerCharacterStatusConstants.Matched
member.summary: The character was matched to an appropriate representation in the image, and its position determined from that representation.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerCharacterStatusConstants.Inferred
member.summary: The character was not matched to the image, but it occurs within the interior of a text line, and its position is inferred from the poses of surrounding matched characters.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerCharacterStatusConstants.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown: The character was not matched to the image, and it occurs within its own text line. Its pose is completely unknown and is simply returned as the identity pose.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerLineTypeConstants
member.summary: Specifies the geometric form of a line of text, that is, the shape of a baseline. The values indicate that a baseline is a line segment, a circular arc, or either type, respectively.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerLineTypeConstants.Straight
member.summary: Specifies that the shape of the baseline of a line of text is a line segment.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerLineTypeConstants.Circular
member.summary: Specifies that the shape of the baseline of a line of text is a circular arc.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerLineTypeConstants.Any
member.summary: Specifies that the shape of the baseline of a line of text is either a line segment or a circular arc.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerOrientationModeConstants
member.summary: Specifies whether the expected orientation of a character is explicitly specified by the client, or is the average of all orientations of characters along the same line of text.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerOrientationModeConstants.Specified
member.summary: The orientation of the lines of text are explicitly specified by the client.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerOrientationModeConstants.Average
member.summary: The orientation of a line of text is the average of all orientations of characters along that same line of text.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerOrientationReferenceConstants
member.summary: Specifies whether character orientations are referenced to the selected space of the image or the local baseline direction.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.OC.CogOCArrangerOrientationReferenceConstants.SelectedSpace
